Brazil: After several years of open warfare, the Dutch withdraw from Brazil; the Portuguese paid off a war debt in payments of salt.
Chile: A Spanish army led by Juan de Salazar is defeated by local Mapuche-Huilliches as it tries to cross Bueno River in Southern Chile.
Poland:
Khmelnytskyi Uprising ends
Russo-Polish War begins
Russia: Khmelnytsky Uprising: Under the Treaty of Pereyaslav, Left-bank Ukraine, the territory of the Zaporozhian Host, allies itself with Russia. Russo-Polish War (1654â€“1667): The Russian army invaded Poland.
Sweden: Queen Christina abdicates throne and converts to Roman Catholicism, creating major scandal
Taiwan: Locusts, plague, and earthquakes greatly damage Taiwan
